title: Camden teen shot to death
content:
CAMDEN - A 15-year-old Camden boy shot and killed another teenager Saturday evening on a city street.
Police found the victim, 15-year-old Antiqouns Beatty of Camden, shortly before 5:30 p.m. Saturday in the 1200 block of Mechanic Street. They had gone there after someone called 911, said the Camden County Prosecutor's Office.
MORE CRIME: Merchantville man accused of masterminding cross-country drug ring
The suspect was the fourth minor to be accused of a Camden homicide this year.
The alleged killer's name was not released due to his age. He was held in the county's youth detention center on a charge of aggravated manslaughter, the prosecutor's office said.
Authorities did not disclose a motive for the daylight mshooting.
The wounded teen was found in the street. He was pronounced dead a short time later at Cooper University Hospital.
Authorities previously this year have charged minors in connection with two fatal shootings in Camden. They allege a Camden girl, then 16, killed 13-year-old Nathaniel Plummer Jr. in East Camden on Jan. 7 and a Merchantville 15-year-old gunned down Terron Phillips, 19, in Cramer Hill on May 18.
A 16-year-old was charged with the hit-and-run death of Tia Walker, 53, in Cooper Plaza on April 25.
There have been 27 homicides in Camden so far this year, compared to 13 at the same time in 2015.
Anyone with information about the shooting is urged to contact prosecutor's office Detective Christopher Sarson at (856) 225-8640 or Camden County Police Detective Saladin Webb at (856) 757-7420. Information also may be emailed to ccpotips@ccprosecutor.org.
